analyzed: ku m'a ra kr'i da r'u pa ni ban dha ban dha /

analyzed: sa ma ya ma nu sma ra phat phat sv'ah'a /

original: 'dis bsrung ba byas nas phyogs rnams bcing ba dang / grogs rnams dang / dkyil 'khor dang / thab khung bcing ba dang / ma rungs pa dang / rab tu ma rungs pa thams cad 'gugs par byed pa dang / skud pa dkar po la lan bdun bzlas te /
analyzed: 'dis bsrung ba byas nas phyogs rnams bcing ba dang / grogs rnams dang / dkyil 'khor dang / thab khung bcing ba dang / ma rungs pa dang / rab tu ma rungs pa thams cad 'gugs par byed pa dang / skud pa dkar po la lan bdun bzlas te /
translated: Having enchanted a white thread seven times,

original: rked pa'i phyogs su bcings na thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rked pa'i phyogs su bcings na thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: bzlas pa'i dus thams cad dang / khrus kyi dus thams cad du yang bgegs ma rungs pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sngags 'di 'bum phrag gcig bzlas na des ni las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i dus thams cad dang / khrus kyi dus thams cad du yang bgegs ma rungs pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sngags 'di 'bum phrag gcig bzlas na des ni las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At all times of recitation and at all times of bathing, in order to destroy wicked obstructors and bring about complete pacification, one should recite this mantra one hundred thousand times. By that, one will be able to perform all activities.

original: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pa dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pa dgod par bya'o //

original: las thams cad la thams cad du byed par 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: las thams cad la thams cad du byed par 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: One will be able to perform all activities everywhere, not otherwise.

original: de nas sgrub pa po sa sa dang / lci ba'i phye ma la sogs pa blangs te ci bde bar khrus byas @172b te; srog chags med pa'i chus kyang bkrus te /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po sa sa dang / lci ba'i phye ma la sogs pa blangs te ci bde bar khrus byas @172b te; srog chags med pa'i chus kyang bkrus te /
translated: Then the practitioner should take some earth, clay, and so on, and bathe as much as he likes.

original: las thams cad la yang srag chags med pa'i chus bya'o //
analyzed: las thams cad la yang srag chags med pa'i chus bya'o //
translated: He should also bathe with water that is free of living beings.

original: de nas sa dang / lci ba'am /
analyzed: de nas sa dang / lci ba'am /
translated: Then, with earth, clay,

original: gzhan yang dri zhim bo dang ldan pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par gyis byugs te de'i 'og tu khrus bya'o //🔽chu'i nang du bshang gci yang dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dri zhim bo dang ldan pa'i yo byad kyi khyad par gyis byugs te de'i 'og tu khrus bya'o // chu'i nang du bshang gci yang dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: or other fragrant substances, he should anoint himself with special unguents.🔽He should not defecate or urinate in the water.

original: chu gtor zhing dor bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu gtor zhing dor bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: He should not throw his waste into the water.

original: chu la rtse bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu la rtse bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: He should not play in the water.

original: snying rjes bdag dang / sems can thams cad la so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rjes bdag dang / sems can thams cad la so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: He should reflect with compassion on himself and all sentient beings.

original: bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa /
translated: He should reflect on the absence of self, on emptiness, on the pervasiveness of suffering,

original: tshor bas mngon par gnod pa /
analyzed: tshor bas mngon par gnod pa /
translated: on the harm caused by feelings,

original: sdug bsngal thob pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i sbyor bas sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thob pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba'i sbyor bas sdug bsngal ba /
translated: on the suffering of coming and going, and on the suffering of being bound.

original: de bzhin du sems can sgrub pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can sgrub pa dang bral ba /
translated: In the same way, he sees that sentient beings are devoid of spiritual practice.

original: sngags rig pas 'di lta bur 'jig pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshogs kyis nye bar khyab pa /🔽'khor ba'i rgya mtsho brgal dka' ba la gnas pa'i bdag nyid du mthong zhing gnas med pa dang / skyob pa med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / shin tu dman pa'i yid can du bdag nyid brtags la sgom pa pos mi gang tsam gyi chu'am /
analyzed: sngags rig pas 'di lta bur 'jig pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi tshogs kyis nye bar khyab pa / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho brgal dka' ba la gnas pa'i bdag nyid du mthong zhing gnas med pa dang / skyob pa med pa dang / skyabs med pa dang / shin tu dman pa'i yid can du bdag nyid brtags la sgom pa pos mi gang tsam gyi chu'am /
translated: He sees that they are pervaded by the mass of suffering, such as destruction, distraction, and disintegration, and so forth.🔽He sees that they are situated in the ocean of cyclic existence, which is difficult to cross. He sees that they are without a place, without a protector, without a refuge, and of inferior mind.

original: lte ba tsam gyi chu la gnas te /
analyzed: lte ba tsam gyi chu la gnas te /

original: chu de nyid kyi dbus su sems rtse gcig tu nye bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: chu de nyid kyi dbus su sems rtse gcig tu nye bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that water, he should fix his mind one-pointedly.

original: dang po re zhig padma chen po'i rtse lag la me tog padma chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dang po re zhig padma chen po'i rtse lag la me tog padma chen po dang ldan pa /

original: padma @173a *// chen po'i 'dab mas nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: padma @173a *// chen po'i 'dab mas nye bar mdzes pa /

original: blta na sdug pa /
analyzed: blta na sdug pa /

original: sdong bu rin po che bee d'urya'i rang bzhin las byung ba /
analyzed: sdong bu rin po che bee d'urya'i rang bzhin las byung ba /

original: padma'i ge sar rin po che mrgad las grub pa 'dab ma stong shel las byas pa /
analyzed: padma'i ge sar rin po che mrgad las grub pa 'dab ma stong shel las byas pa /

original: shin tu rnam par kha phye ba /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par kha phye ba /

analyzed: de'i rjes su skyes pa'i shel dang / padma r'a ga'i me tog gis mdzes par byas pa /

analyzed: de'i steng du seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rang bzhin las grub pa rin po che du mas nye bar mjes pa /

original: ras bcos bu zung gis rab tu bkab pa /
analyzed: ras bcos bu zung gis rab tu bkab pa /

analyzed: de'i steng du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bsgom par bya ste /

original: chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa /
analyzed: chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa /

analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gi dkyil 'khor gyis brgyan pa /

analyzed: sku'i tshad chen po nam mkha' la thug pa dang 'dra ba /

original: skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /

original: g-yas su yang 'phags pa 'jam dpal rgyan thams cad kyis nye bar mjes par byas pa /
analyzed: g-yas su yang 'phags pa 'jam dpal rgyan thams cad kyis nye bar mjes par byas pa /

original: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: sitting on a lotus seat,

original: rnga yab thogs pa /
analyzed: rnga yab thogs pa /
translated: holding a fly whisk,

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i zur na gnas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i zur na gnas pa /

analyzed: sku'i kha dog dmar skya 'am; gur gum bdar ba lta bu'o //

analyzed: g-yon du'ang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kha dog ston ka'i zla rgyu 'dra ba rnga yab thogs pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems @173b dpa' brgyad la 'phags pa byams pa dang / kun tu bzang po dang / sa'i snying po dang / nam mkha' mdzod dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / ngan song sbyong ba dang / 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje dang /
translated: In the same way, there are eight bodhisattvas: noble Maitreya, Samantabhadra, Kṣitigarbha, Ākāśagarbha, Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkambhin, Saṃgrāma­vijayā, noble Vajrapāṇi,

original: khams bzang can te /
analyzed: khams bzang can te /
translated: and Bhadra­kāyika.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bcu po de dag gi g-yas logs su rang sangs rgyas brgyad bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bcu po de dag gi g-yas logs su rang sangs rgyas brgyad bsgom par bya ste /
translated: To the right of those ten bodhisattvas, one should visualize eight pratyekabuddhas:

analyzed: 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / ba lang bdag dang / bha ra dva dza bsod snyoms len dang / pi lin da'i bu dang / 'phags pa sgra gcan 'dzin dang / 'od srung chen po dang / 'phags pa kun dga' bo'o //
translated: the noble Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Śāriputra, Gavāṃpati, Bhāradvāja, Piṇḍolabharadvāja, the noble Rāhula, Mahākāśyapa, and the noble Ānanda.

analyzed: nyan thos chen po de dag dang nye bar dge slong gi dge 'dun mtha' yas pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nye ba na rang sangs rgyas bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po brgyad kyi gnas su yang byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the places of the eight great bodhisattvas, one should visualize the inconceivable assembly of bodhisattvas.

analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha'i dkyil thams cad du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po dang ldan pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: In this way, one should visualize the great assembly of the retinue throughout the whole sky.

original: bdag kyang lte ba tsam gyi chu la @174a *//
analyzed: bdag kyang lte ba tsam gyi chu la @174a *//

analyzed: autpal la sngon po dang / me tog rnam pa sna tshogs la tshad chen po dang / tshan chen por gyur pa'i ri rab tsam gyi me tog gi snyim pas bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par mchod de /
translated: With a handful of blue lotuses, with a handful of various flowers, with a handful of flowers as large as Mount Meru, he should make offerings to the Blessed One.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lha dang / mi'i phye ma dang / gos dang gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag dang / mar me rab tu mang po bya ba khri phrag brgya stong yid du 'ong bas yang dag par mchod par byed la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lha dang / mi'i phye ma dang / gos dang gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag dang / mar me rab tu mang po bya ba khri phrag brgya stong yid du 'ong bas yang dag par mchod par byed la /
translated: He should make offerings to all the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas with hundreds of thousands of millions of pleasing divine and human powders, garments, parasols, victory banners, flags, and lamps.

original: de bzhin du lha dang / mi'i gtor ma dang / bdug spos dang / bshos la sogs pa bsnyen bkur thams cad dang / yo byad rnams nye bar dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang / mi'i gtor ma dang / bdug spos dang / bshos la sogs pa bsnyen bkur thams cad dang / yo byad rnams nye bar dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, he should offer all the divine and human sacrificial cakes, incense, food, and so forth, and all the articles of service.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i mdzod spu nas kyang 'od zer byung ste /
translated: From the ūrṇā hair between the eyebrows of the Blessed Śākyamuni, light rays also emerge.

original: bdag nyid dang / phyogs thams cad kyang snang bas khyab par sgom mo //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang / phyogs thams cad kyang snang bas khyab par sgom mo //
translated: One should visualize oneself and all directions pervaded by light.

original: zlos pa po bsam gtan la zhugs ma thag tu tshangs pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: zlos pa po bsam gtan la zhugs ma thag tu tshangs pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur /
translated: As soon as the reciter enters into meditation, he will obtain the result equal to the merit of Brahmā.

original: nges par byang chub la yang gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par byang chub la yang gzhol bar 'gyur ro //

original: de la sogs pa'i bsam gtan ni //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i bsam gtan ni //

original: mchog dang bar dang tha ma ni //
analyzed: mchog dang bar dang tha ma ni //

analyzed: de bzhin ras ris bar ma bsgom //

original: mdor na rnam gsum sgom pa ni //
analyzed: mdor na rnam gsum sgom pa ni //
translated: In brief, the meditation on the three

analyzed: sdig pa'i rnyog pa ma lus 'jig /

original: mkhas pas sgom pa'i rnam pa ni //
analyzed: mkhas pas sgom pa'i rnam pa ni //

analyzed: de las gzhan du mi bsten te //

analyzed: ci 'dod cho ga bstan nas ni //
translated: Having taught the desired rite,

original: zlos pas bsam gtan byas nas su //
analyzed: zlos pas bsam gtan byas nas su //
translated: the reciter, having performed the meditation,

analyzed: sngags kyi lha ni gshegs gsol te //
translated: should request the departure of the mantra deity.🔽Having offered the welcome gift,

original: mchod yon gsol nas ci bde bar //
analyzed: mchod yon gsol nas ci bde bar //
